Sentencas: Using an Y(NO3)(3) solution as a liquid medium, an Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ (8 mol% yttria-stabilized zirconia) electrolyte can be fabricated by a cold sintering process (CSP) and a conventional sintering (CS) at 1100 degrees C, and a relative density of more than 95% can be achieved.
Titulo: Phase evolution and enhanced sinterability of cold sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ

Sentencas: The phase structure, sintering behaviour and electrical properties of the 8YSZ samples were investigated in this study.
Titulo: Phase evolution and enhanced sinterability of cold sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ

Sentencas: The results indicate that the sinterability of the 8YSZ electrolyte can be enhanced by the CSP.
Titulo: Phase evolution and enhanced sinterability of cold sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ

Sentencas: Moreover, the formation of the monoclinic phase originating from the Fe2O3 dopant was greatly suppressed by introducing the Y(NO3)(3) solution into the CSP, which greatly improved the electrical properties (i.e. the ionic conductivity) of the 8YSZ electrolyte.
Titulo: Phase evolution and enhanced sinterability of cold sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ

Sentencas: The sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ provides support for the fabrication of high-performance solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) in a convenient and energy-saving way.
Titulo: Phase evolution and enhanced sinterability of cold sintered Fe2O3-doped 8YSZ
